It gave her small comfort that Link's appetite was unhindered by whatever strange event had affected him. But still, the look of pain on his face haunted her. It couldn't be "nothing."

The impossible was happening - Link was putting on weight! Not only was it showing, but it was as though with every bite of food he swallowed, his girth was increasing.

For a few moments, Zelda watched him transfixed, as though she were hypnotized by Link's expansion. His tunic began straining at the seems, the stitching around his sleeves peeling back to reveal bits of soft flesh and his chest puffing out as his pecs filled with additional weight. A second chin was taking shape on his face. From Zelda's seat, it was hard to see his stomach, but she thought she saw the tablecloth beginning had started lifting around Link's waist.

A snapping noise broke Zelda of her trance as something flew through the air. She stood up and walked over to where the object had landed. Behind a white marble pillar was all that remained of Link's belt.

"Link! Stop eating!" Zelda yelled to him, running over to the expanding hero of time and trying to wrestle his food from him.

Link entered his bedchamber in Hyrule Castle and sat on the edge of his bed. His head was still cloudy from the pang, in what can only be described as a bout of vertigo. He placed his head down softly onto the pillow, as sudden movements caused his head to spin. He stared up at the lush fresco on the ceiling and watched as the familiar faces spun around, faded in and out of focus and seemed to melt off the roof. He gently closed his eyes, promising himself that he was only resting his eyes, not sleeping.

Sure enough, he was soon fast asleep. Supper had been laid next to his bed several hours ago by the help. Zelda now stood over him, her hands clasped together, watching him, hoping he was alright. There was a cold sweat over his brow, matting his light hair to his forhead. She wiped his forehead with her handkerchief and left the room quietly. The sound of the door closing awoke Link from his slumber. He was still slightly dizzy, so he took some water and sat up in the bed, holding his head in his hands. He wiped the hair from his forehead and propped himself against the wall. The tingling sensation from several hours ago had returned and began to feel as though someone was rubbing a silk sheet all over his body. His tunic began to feel tight. He looked down and saw a roundness to his form he had not noticed before. More astounding was the fact that it seemed to be expanding before his very eyes. His belt began to hold tighter and tighter and he realised that he was growing!

"What's happening to me?" Link stammered. His stomach was actually growing outwards. He watched in astonishment as he continued to grow and the bright green fabric covering his body pulled tighter and tighter over his thickening chest and stomach. His torso was blowing up as though he had spent the last week feasting constantly. Too astonished to move, he lay back moaning to himself "What is this? Awaken, Link, awaken!" The seams of the tunic began to pull apart at the side and his stomach stopped growing. He looked like a stuffed sausage in his little green tunic. He looked down at himself and realised he must take the belt off, or risk being cut in half. He fiddled with the buckle, unable to see it over his newfound waistline. He rubbed his hands over his body, wondering what had happened.

However, it was not over yet. The tingling sensation moved from his torso to his arms, which also began to expand, stretch and grow. Link panicked.

"Stop!" He cried, "Stop!" His arms pushed away from his body as they grew. The soft white hose began to run and his hands inside his leather gauntlets began to squeeze against the fabric. There was a loud snapping noise and Link looked at his arms to see the hose fall away in shreds from his former muscled arms. While this was happening, the sensation spread to the rest of his body. His legs and his face began to expand. Was he going to pop? What was to happen? No, but his limbs grew until they were the size of the rest of his body. He looked in astonishment at his hands, his arms, his legs and stomach. He had expanded amazingly. His clothes were creaking under the pressure of his larger body, ready to burst at any second. He touched what was once his bicep to find out what had happened. Link was unsure if he was filled with air, water or if he had simply fattened up. As far as he could tell, he had gained weight. He had gained about fifteen pounds of fat in the past few minutes. The tingling sensation faded away, the dizziness subsided and Link relaxed against the wall, his head still reeling in awe of the situation. He closed his eyes and drew a breath. On expelling the breath, he, almost instantly, seemed to add another ten pounds to his already larger frame. His tunic, which was now skintight, split open. His undershirt tore it's buttons from their holes and his gauntlets tore along the sides.

His clothes now in shreds around him, Link looked at his body. What now?

Blushing, Link immediately brushed off the idea of calling someone for help- it wouldn't do for anyone to see the Hero fo Time as he was now.

Stepping over towards the full length mirror in the room - a rare and expensive item in Hyrule these days, something she only put in the rooms of very important people who stayed in the castle- Link looked himself over in full, but not before stripping off what was left of his clothes until he was clothes in the only two garments he had left that fit- his loincloth, which while it fit was stretched to an uncomfortable point, and his hat.

The damage was evident.

The muscles he had trained so hard to get over the years had vanished. His biceps, once toned to a perfect degree from all his years of swordsmanship and archery were now soft, as were his legs, as if he'd only lounged around eating the past few years of his life, instead of running throughout Hyrule and dodging enemy attacks.

Of course, worst of all was his tomach and chest. His once fine and attractive pectoral and abdominal muscles had completely disappared, his abs replaced by a rather generous beginning belly that flopped over his loincloth and jiggled this way and that when he walked. As for his chest- he was beginning to develop breasts! No longer manly in appearance, Link's pectorals now drooped slightly as the fat had accumulated there.

Tentatively, Link poked his belly, watching as the action caused his now rather flabby stomach to vibrate. Then even more carefully, Link inhaled as he had before, then exhaled again.

To his slight horror, and slight curiosity, Link watched in the mirror as he put on weigh again- though this time to a lesser extent. The growth stared short of five pounds, luckily, though it was enough to give his "breasts" a more rounded look as well as make his loincloth all the more tighter.

"Whatever it was that did this to me...its stopping at least for now." Link said in an attempt to comfort himself.

In truth, he didn't really look fat, or at least, not as fat as King Zora, or Talon, or Darunia, at least. He actually looked like someone who had been fit once and had then had been chained down and force fed fattening foods for a few months. He was still tan, at least, too.

"The question is what...or who." Link muttered, his eyes narrowing as thoughts of Ganondorf and his many minions came to mind. "But how am I going to fix this?"

Primarily, Link needed to find a way out of the castle, or at least to a more private location. And for that he needed some clothes. While it might have caused a bit of a tizzy if he had went out in nothing but a loincloth before, now it would most likely only elicit screams...or people fainting, perhaps.

And, if he was to leave the castle, he'd need to decide where to go.

Sighing, Link felt his body over again. It felt...different, to say the least. Maybe a hot bath would help him sort out his problems?

Link groaned, turning over in his bed, away from the offending morning sunlight that had the audacity to hit him in the face.

"What does a hero have to do to get some sleep in this place?" He muttered grumpily with a yawn, as he grudgingly brushed away his plans of slumber to walk over to the window of his treehouse.

Looking out over the once again peaceful forest, Link smiled in content as the Kokiri children began to file out of their houses, ready for another day of play and laughter.

Peace had finally returend to Hyrule, and this time, it looked like it was going to stay. Ganondorf had been vanquished, erased from time itself, and the era of The Imprisoning War forgotten by all but a selct few, namely himself, Princess Zelda, and the Six Sages that guarded the land.

Instead of travelling the land, fighting monsters, and rescuing sages, the past seven years had been spent exploring the land peacefully, spending lazy days at Lonlon Ranch with Malon or frolicking though the castle gardens with Zelda, or basically just having fun.

Now things had come full circle. This year marked the final year of The Imprisoning War, and consequently, the complete destuction of the alternate timeline in which Ganondorf was still in power. To commerate this joyous occasion, Zelda had herself declared this year to be one of grand celebrations, with feasts and parties held in every locale of Hyrule, from The Gerudo's Fortress in the far west to Zora's Domain in the east. All of Hyrule had been rejoicing all year long, and though few actually knew the purpose of the celebrations, everyone had been happy to participate.

Walking away from the window to get dressed for the day, Link grabbed one of his trademark Kokiri tunics and pulled it over his head, and in doing so caught a glimpse of his body.

No longer the sculpted masterpiece of a Hero's form, Link's body had changed from what it had been in the other timeline, thanks in part to growing up in a peaceful world where fighting with monsters was not a daily activity as well as overindulging himself at the many festivals that had taken place throughout Hyrule in the past year.

In fact, now a generous portion of flab drooped over Link's belt where before there had been finely sculpted abdominals.

Poking the portruding bulge of fat, Link walked over to his mirror, a present Zelda had given him a few years ago, to examine himself.

In truth, not only had he grown a small belly, but he looked a bit soft all over. His face looked a bit chubby and he had the start of a double chin, and what muscles he still had were also covered in fat. And of course, his gut was obvious enough, falling over his pants as if to taunt him: "Tsk, tsk tsk. Someone's let themself go."

Blushing slightly, Link looked away from the mirror and put his tunic on, noting with a bit of happiness that his newfound stomach rolls weren't as obvious when he was clothed.

"Have I really gotten that lazy?" Link asked himself, again diagnosing himself in the mirror and patting his spare tire.

"Considering that you've spent the last seven years eating, sleeping, and playing instead of slaying monsters, I'd say yes."

Link jumped and turned to the source of the voice, surprised to see Saria standing in the doorway to his house, chuckling lightly,

"Saria?! When did you get here?" Link asked, blushing and sucking in his gut.

"Oh, a few minutes ago. You seriously must have let your skills go to let me sneak up on you." Saria said, bouncing over to her taller friend and looking up at him with a smirk.

Link poted for a few seconds before sighing and turning his attention back to the mirror.

"Really though Saria...what do you think? Am I getting...fat?" He asked her with a hint of nervousness in his voice.

Saria rolled her eyes before laughing.

"Link, please. You're not fat. King Zora is fat." Saria said, poking Link in the stomach. "You may have put on a few pounds, but for all I care you could put on 500. You deserve to enjoy yourself after what you went through to save Hyrule and everyone in it."

"So you're saying I'm going to end up like King Zora?" Link asked in false horror.

Saria chuckled again at her friend's joke.

"No, I'm saying its no crime if you're a little tubby." Saria said playfully before giving Link a serious look. "You're not the Hero of Time anymore Link. You're just you. Its okay to be a normal person."

"Still...I don't know. I think I've let myself go." Link muttered, as Saria through her hands up in defeat.

"Okay, Link. Fine, you're fat. And you're going to keep getting fatter and fatter and fatter!" Saria chanted, barely avoiding the pillow that Link threw at her.

"Take that back right now you little wood imp!" Link shouted, chasing Saria out of his treehouse.

"Never." Saria retorted, sticking her tongue out of Link from his porch, before she began to climb down the ladder.

"Argh. Sometimes I think I should just move to the Castle Town. Or maybe Kakariko, its peaceful there." Link mumbled to himself as he watched Saria run off into the forest.

"Oh, by the way Link!" Saria, stopped and turned to shout at Link. "I came to remind you about the festival tomorrow night! Remember to come, the Princess and the other sages will be there!"

"Great, another festival." Link muttered to himself, putting a hand on his stomach, before replying to Saria. "I know Saria! Under the branches of the Great Deku Tree!"

Saria nodded and then waved to Link before running off to play with the other Kokiri.

"Maybe I should watch my diet from now on..." Link thought outloud to himslef as he descended the ladder to his house himself.

Then he though of all of the delicacies that would be present at the festival, drooling at the possibilities. Roasted deku nets, fruits and juices of every vareity, forest potatoes, kokiri bread and if he was lucky, Roast Cucco.

Being very close to the forest and the creatures within, of course, the Kokiri tended to keep to organic foods, but there was always the chance there would be meat.

"Ah, to hell with it." Link muttered. Saria was right. He was just being silly. So he'd put on a few pounds. He was going to enjoy himself for the rest of the year, at each and every festival. He'd get back to training again...eventually. But for now, he was just going to have a good time and eat whatever he wanted.

"Hmm...now what to do today?" Link asked himself as he took out his ocarina. Where to go?

He could call Epona and maybe go see Malon at the Lonlon Ranch, or perhaps warp to the Temple of Time and visit Zelda at the castle.

He could also spend the day around the forest, something he hadn't done for a while. Later in the day, the Kokiri would begin getting ready for the festival they were to host. If he hung around, he might even get to influence the festival's menu, or even make a few taste tests.

Stretching, Link yawned again and contemplated just going back to sleep. It was still a little early and he could do with a few more hours of sleep. It wasn't exactly healthy, but it was pretty tempting.

Malon watched him from the window of the barn. She blushed slightly as he ran by the window, the sight of Link's toned form sending her heart into a tizzy. Even under the loose tunic, she could tell that he was still muscular. As she did so, she carefully milked the cow in front of her.

The cow that she was currently milking was special. It had been given a special diet to increase its milk output. It had all been Inigo's idea - he was the one who counted the Rupees on the ranch. This was the first cow they had tested it on and Malon had indeed noticed an increase in the amount it gave today. However, since the diet had begun, the cow had also tripled in girth, barely able to move on its own, though otherwise it seemed healthy. She pet the large cow on the forehead as she heard Link gallop by again.

Malon started to pour the milk into the bottles. She smiled at the thought of the kind Kairu in the Castle Town who was a client of the ranch. However, she'd noticed that over the last few trips to deliver milk to him, he'd seemed a little heavier each time. At first it was hard to notice, because he'd always been so incredibly skinny, but by the third week Kairu had a noticeable paunch and a second chin.

Malon didn't like to admit it, but she had actually thought Kairu more attractive as he grew bigger. As she looked out the window once more at Link, she started wondering what he would look like at a larger size. "Now, now, Malon," she scolded herself, "He's fine the way he is."

But still the thought lingered...

Malon heard Link gallop up to the door of the barn. She finished her bottling quickly and smiled brightly as he entered. "Hey Fairy Boy!" she quipped, "You sure racing around 50 times was enough?!"

Link smiled, then looked over to the Lon-Lon Milk she'd just bottled. "Hey, is that fresh?" he asked, excitement in his voice. Link's love for Lon-Lon Milk was legendary in Hyrule.

***

"You yourself said it. The races are rejoicing! Even the Sheikah ways may be revived soon enough! And evil, apparently, has given up on Hyrule, at least for now." Malon stated, winking at Link. "It makes me wonder what you're going to do now. What happens to heroes after their battle is won?"

Debris smashed into the ground, a narrow spike of stone stuck into a wall. The sound, the quaking, it all became too much. Everything went black.

***

"I didn't do that, that weapon..."

Link sat up. The stone surface that served as his bed left a tight knot in his back. He twisted, each vertebrae popped. A sigh of relief left Link's lips. He looked around himself. Waning sunlight lit up behind the thin tent walls. He turned to the goron that shared his name and craned his neck up.

"This is your caravan isn't it?" Said Link. He poked his head out of an opening in the tent.

Tall red mountains surrounded him on all sides. Hyrule castle a mere dot in the distance. Link rubbed his eyes and watched the sunset on the horizon.

"Ugh, I missed the parade."

"Not much left to miss. Princess Zelda calmed down the people and urged us to get you to safety." Said Link the goron. "We obliged, partly because we never leave a brother behind and..."

"And?"

"Father requested you come visit him after the parade. We were to invite you after the festivities, but somebody blew up a caterer." Link the goron flashed link an impish grin.

"Darunia isn't with you?"

A cold wind brushed past Link's face while the sunlight gave way to darkness.

"Father...is..." Link the goron's jovial tone fell.

***

"You can't be dying!" Link shouted to the goron patriarch.

The faint torchlight cast growing shadows on the walls of the throne room. Darunia's hard stare softened at the outburst of his old friend. He sighed and turned to his attendants.

"Leave us." Said Darunia. The guards and attendants obeyed their leader.

Link the goron and another unfamiliar goron remained present. Darunia turned towards them. A frown on his face.

"You two as well. This is for me and the Hylian only."

What could he have to say that he couldn't say to his own son? Link the goron turned to the door reluctantly, but he trusted his father. The Hylian that served as his namesake held a bond that transcended age and species with his father. Something no one but them alone could ever understand.

The other goron stood his ground.

"Brother, your behavior has been inexcusable." Said the goron. "What secrets do you have to keep from us? From me? This puny Hylian could not possibly undertake anything you ask."

"And that sort of behavior is exactly why I have called him, Grouger." Said Darunia. "This human has done more for my people than you or the kingdom of Hyrule combined. Leave us, and do not make me repeat myself."

The one called Grouger turned to Link with the deepest fire in his eyes. The Hylian gulped and turned to Darunia. Even in his current state, he still carried the strength to destroy any unruly pests in his presence. Grouger stormed out of the room and closed the doors behind him.

"My time is short, Link." Said Darunia. "My late wife's brother watches me like a piece of meat on a spit. By birthright and seniority, he will take the tribe."

"Isn't your son next in line?"

"That boy, bless his heart, is too weak to stand up to his uncle. He knows no hardship nor the darkness some are capable of." Said Darunia. "Yes, Grouger will take it. What's more, I fear it is all by design."

Memories flooded back, when Ganandorf killed the only father he ever knew. He cursed the Great Deku tree, and with that curse came his death.

"You don't mean to say..."

"My illness is not natural, I cannot say how I know, just that I do." Said Darunia. "You are the last hope I have for my tribe."

"What do I need to do?"

"You are my successor Link." Said Darunia. "I have chosen you to take my place."

"My duty is to Hyrule Darunia. Besides, gorons won't follow a Hylian chieftain. That's pushing it a bit too far."

"Hyrule is in serious danger if Grouger gets his hands on my throne." Said Darunia. "He sees your kind as weak. Why should a creature with such soft skin and bone be the ones in charge around here?"

Link did not speak. That still did not answer his second question. Darunia pointed to a small chest beside his throne.

"As for your Hylian issue, I must ask a sacrifice of you." Said Darunia. "Within this chest is the means to ask the goddess Din a favor."

The Hylian walked to the chest and threw the latch. The lid creaked open. Inside revealed a fine cut ruby. Within the gem appeared to be a dancing flame.

"One miracle per chieftain, and this is the miracle I have chosen for you." Said Darunia. "Go to the Goron's hall of chieftains, and present this gem to the statue of Din. You will become a true goron brother by her magic."

"Sacrifice my humanity to become one of you..." Link looked at the special gem. "If that's the only way, I guess I have no choice. Not like the hero of time is needed anymore. Ganondorf is long gone."

"You always held the strength of a goron in your soul. Now is a chance to let that strength come forward physically." Said Darunia. "I knew I chose wisely, now go, before Grouger becomes more suspicious than he already is."

Link stepped out side of the throne room, the ruby felt heavy in his pocket. He looked over his shoulder, the dancing torchlight faded to embers, then only darkness. He took a deep breath. "Wow, he really does look good with a bit of belly on him..." she thought to herself as the competition continued.

More time went on as the fish in their buckets continued to deplete rapidly. But no matter how much Link consumed, the King was simply too vast an eater to defeat. Link's eating pace began to slow down, as he winced in pain, groaning a bit as he reached over for another fish. But as he brought it to his mouth, the young Hylian could eat no more. Groaning a bit more audibly, Link dropped the fish back in the bucket and clutched his slightly bloated stomach in pain. "Urgh...n-no more...you win, your highness..." groaned Link in pain as King Zora had just finished scarfing down every last piece of fish in his bucket and laughing heartily. "Oh ho ho! A valiant effort indeed, young man! But I fear you are out of your element when it comes to consuming fish against a Zora! Let alone a Zora as vast as I!" the King exclaimed, slapping his fat belly with both hands for emphasis. He then looked down at Link, who was still groaning in pain and looking a bit ill, then tilted his head with a bit of concern. "Oh dear, you're beginning to look a little green around the gills there, my boy," said the King. Link smirked a bit groggily and said, "S-sorry, sire. But...*urp*...I don't think I've ever eaten this much fish in my life...m-my stomach is killing me..."

"Goodness. Ruto? Be a dear and please take our young champion to our guest quarters?" Ruto nodded and placed one of Link's arms around her shoulder as she assisted the young Hylian towards the royal guest quarters. She gently placed Link atop the bed where he immediately plopped backwards, allowing his bare belly to stick upward a few inches. Smiling, she sat besides him and began to rub his belly affectionately. Link smiled with delight, enjoying Ruto's gentle massaging of his aching midsection. "Oh wow...Ruto, that feels incredible!" Ruto smiled and said, "You've earned it, Link." Feeling how tense and hard his bloated volleyball sized belly felt, she admired the touch and sensation more, and noted, "You certainly outdid yourself this time, didn't you, Link?" Link opened his mouth to respond, but instead let out a huge belch which lasted several seconds straight. Ruto laughed, patting Link's belly playfully and said, "Well, excuse you."

Blushing a bit, Link tried to apologize, but burped once again instead, his face getting even more flush with embarrassment. Ruto laughed a bit and said, "Don't worry about it. Your stomach's just not used to working off so much food at once." Link shook his head and said, "I almost had him too..." Ruto smirked and said, "I've never seen a human keep up with my father as well as you did. But he's unmatched when it comes to eating fish." Link scowled and said, "Well...let's see if I can't fix that..." Ruto, grinning a bit to herself, decided to egg Link on by adding, "I don't know, Link. The only being on all this land who can eat even REMOTELY as much as my father is Lord Jabu Jabu, and we saw first hand how big HIS belly is." Link scoffed and, confidently but still weakly, said, "If I can beat the King of Evil, but can't eat more than the King of Zoras, then what kind of hero am I? I've gotta challenge your father to a rematch! If I can train my stomach enough to be able to take in more food, I'll have no problem beating the king!"

Ruto continued to rub Link's belly and work up some more pent-up pressure pockets as she smirked to herself, seeing her plan come to fruition...
15522.title: King Zora

155222.content:
"Maybe I can help" Link looked up at her slightly confused. She left the room momentarily and returned with a book of spells.

"In this book there are hundreds of spells. Surely one can help you out eat my father." Link perked up at this and grinned. "This first spell doubles your appetite allowing you to eat much more. The only problem is you become twice as lazy, avoiding working out, sleeping frequently and just laying around all the time with little care to what's going on around you.

The next makes you able to instantly digest food, making more room in your stomach for more food. But all the weight you gain will go directly to your stomach only and makes you hungry more frequently.

The third makes you a bottomless pit. Always hungry for more and never getting full. However, it's greatest asset is also it's greatest drawback. You'll be constantly hungry, always thinking about food and getting hunger pangs when you don't eat within an hour.

Finally, the last spell changes your perspectives. You'll be obsessed with your stomach. Wanting it to be bigger and bigger. You may even stuff yourself beyond what you can handle, passing out from overstuffing. Though it doesn't have many major drawbacks besides detesting exercise and vegetables.

So, what'll it be?"
155222.title: Ruto offers a spell which can help Link eat more

1552221.content:
These two spells seemed safer. Besides, with these, Link could actually stop eating. He would also be able to be lost in the mesmerisation of stuffed belly rub again.

The doubled appetite would surely allow him to beat the King and even then some. He could even get in a little exercise, maybe, if he's lucky. He would be trying to avoid it though and he would be sleeping quite a lot.

The instant digestion would allow him to keep the muscles in his arms and legs. He also could work off the flab in his belly too. Some of the time that originally would have gone into exercise would go into eating though, making it even more difficult to lose the weight.

But which should he choose?
1552221.title: Doubled appetite or instant digestion

choices: Go for one of the two
1552222.content:
Link decided for the last two. He was going to get fat anyway with these spells, he may as well enjoy it.

Well...

He could ask Ruto if there are any other spells...
1552222.title: Getting big anyway

15522221.content:
Time to weigh them up!

There was a risk, that a doubled appetite may not be enough to best King Zora. He hadn't seemed phased when Link was at his limits. If Link could stomach anything though, there was no chance that the King would beat him. Ruto could always reverse the spell afterwards right?

The obsession spell would make it so Link would want to go beyond what he previously thought his limits. And if there was one thing he knew how to do, it was persevere through something he set his mind to. That might be its most critical weakness. He wouldn't want to stop and no-one could make him stop.

Time to decide! What does Link choose?
15522221.title: No limits or obssession?

choices: Follow Link in his belly bloating bash.
Follow Ruto as she searches for the secret to belly eternal.
155222212.content:
"Screw it! I'll have to get big anyway to beat King Zora, I might as well enjoy it! Let's go obsession."

Ruto cast the spell but also secretly cast the Instant digestion spell too. She wanted Link to keep his muscles all she needed was a large belly.

A moment passed after the spell was cast.

"I don't feel any different."

"What? Why didn't it do anything?" The Zora princess lamented, "I'll see if I can work out what I did wrong. We'll try again later." She stormed out the room.

Link sat up, quite an effort with his belly. He placed a hand on it and, subconsciously, stared to rub the orb set in his lap.

"Hey. This feels good." He noted.

He felt the way it was tense. He felt the way it was hard. He felt the way it was heavy. He loved it.

Now to fill it. To make it bigger. Yes, much bigger.
155222212.title: Failure?

15522222.content:
"Are there any other spells?" Link asked

Ruto flicked through the pages of the book. "There's the Puppet eater spell." She replied

"What does it do?"

"When somebody tells you to eat something, you will, whether you want to or not. It doesn't matter who tells you to or what it is, you'll just eat it. You also won't stop until you've finished, no matter the situation."

"It sounds rather dangerous, don't you think?"

"True. It will definitely help you beat my father though won't it?" Link gave her a look of unease, "If you're that worried about it I could combine it with one of the previous spells."
15522222.title: Ask for more

155222222.content:
"I think combining it would be safer." Link replied

"If that's what you want." Ruto glossed over the spells effects again, "Slight problem though. Due to how the puppet eater spell works, I can only combine it with either the instant digestion or belly obsession spells."

Link thought it over. If he picked the instant digestion spell, he wouldn't get full as easily, making it harder to be used against him. If he picked the belly obsession spell though he wouldn't mind if people commanded him to overeat. But what to pick?
155222222.title: Combine it with another.
